title: Fork Oil Change - Oil Draining

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

Do not change the fork adjustment settings. If they are changed, this will change the handling of the motorcycle from those which the rider is used to. Riding with unfamiliar fork settings may cause unexpected handling characteristics leading to loss of control and an accident.

Put on eye protection and be careful when you loosen the top cap. If the fork preload has been adjusted, there can be some spring pressure when the cap is released. If you do not hold the cap firmly, the fork top cap can be released suddenly and cause injury.
Never tightly clamp the outer tube as this will cause the tube to permanently distort. A distorted tube is not serviceable and must be replaced.
With the top cap facing upwards, using
clamp the fork outer tube, then unscrew the top cap from the outer tube.
If the damper is to be removed from the fork, do the step below before you loosen the top cap.
If the damper is to be removed, loosen the damper fixing at the bottom of the fork by a half turn.
Holding the inner and outer tubes together, invert the fork and pour out the fork oil into a suitable container.
Allow the outer tube to slide down the inner to allow access to the spring spacer.

While compressing the fork spring and while the spring holder is in place always wear protective equipment for the face and eyes and never stand directly above or look directly down on the fork. If the spring compressor or holder should dislodge or detach, the resulting release of spring tension could cause parts to fly off resulting in injury to the user.

During the step that follows, measure the length of the threads above the locknut for the installation procedure.
Loosen the damper locknut a small amount, then unscrew and remove the top cap and the rebound adjuster rod, taking care not to bend the rod. The top cap assembly cannot be dismantled.
Measure the length of threads from the lock nut to the damper rod end.

Pump the damper rod to remove all the oil.

While compressing the fork spring and while the spring holder is in place always wear protective equipment for the face and eyes and never stand directly above or look directly down on the fork. If the spring compressor or holder should dislodge or detach, the resulting release of spring tension could cause parts to fly off resulting in injury to the user.
Remove the bump rubber (if not attached), nylon spacer, spring spacer and spring.
Invert the fork and pour out the remaining fork oil into a suitable container.
